page.title: 05Inshore Rescue Service
page.content: Atlantic College was the first in Britain to organise a cliff,beach and inshore rescue service.Since 1962 when the organisation was founded the College has been credited with over 150 rescues of which most have saved lives.Atlantic College is responsible for 15 miles of the Bristol Channel coastline. The lifeboat station at the College belongs to the Royal National Lifeboat Institution and it is on call throughout the whole year.The crew wear special coats and trousers with a lifejacket that contains all the modern equipment.They are also equipped with 2 different types of hats.Sometimes canoes called rescue skis are used for rescuing people that are near the shore.Tuition is given on beach and water safety and the handling of rescue skis.
